page.title: 07ARABLE FARMING
page.content: In spring arable farmers{harrow}the fields which means they rake the fields out flat. After harrowing the farmer plants his crops with a{drill machine. When not in the fields the farmer maintains his machinery. In summer the farmer{sprays}the crops with insecticides so that insects leave the plants alone. As well as spraying they also{fertilise and water the crops. In autumn the farmer {harvests}the crops with a combine harvester. This means cut down the crops and separates the grain from the straw. Grain is kept in silos and straw is kept in bales or stacks. On the other hand peas have to be taken to factories as quickiy as posible. All the bits left in the field is stubble. They{burn}the stubble or plough it in. In winter they give it a final{plough}before winter.
